RECORD.TEXT: 032890433 CTMC 75066875 828710 02/21/1991 12:00:00 AM Unsigned DIS Admission Date : 02/21/1991 Report Status : Discharge Date : 02/26/1991 DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : LEFT RENAL MASS . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : A computerized tomography scan demonstrated a contrast enhancing complex left renal mass . Metastatic work-up was negative . The patient presented for nephrectomy . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY included polycythemia vera . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY included appendectomy and bunionectomy . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION were Hydrea . REVIEW OF SYSTEMS was negative in detail . The patient was a robust white female in no acute distress , afebrile , blood pressure 165/80 . Head and neck were unremarkable . Lungs were clear . Heart had regular rate and rhythm . Rectal examination was guaiac negative . The patient was taken to the operating room by Dr. Suot N. Dragtente on 02-21-91 , where a left radical nephrectomy was performed . The patient thereafter had a benign convalescence , and was discharged on the 5th postoperative day . The oncology fellows from Venbonlea Health followed her course and recommended holding off on her Hydrea while she is hospitalized , and they will follow her as an outpatient and restart her Hydrea when her hematocrit is over 40% . DISPOSITION : The patient was discharged to home . The patient was discharged on a regular diet . CONDITION ON DISCHARGE was stable . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE included Percocet 1 to 2 tablets by mouth every 4 hours as needed for pain , Colace 100 milligrams by mouth twice a day . D : 02/26/91 Batch : 8776 Report : P9055V6 T : 03/02/91 Dicatated By : ESPEXIINE BRIZ , M.D. XT67 [ report_end ]
